news_header: South Korea has imposed new export restrictions on materials for fuel-powered missiles to prevent North Korea's missile development.
news_text: South Korea has implemented new export restrictions on materials used for manufacturing fuel-powered missiles, aiming to hinder North Korea's ballistic missile development. This comes after North Korea launched its first intercontinental ballistic missile since 2023, which, according to state news, is intended to enhance nuclear deterrence. Japanese officials reported that the missile flew for over 86 minutes before landing in the sea, marking a new record according to Japanese Defense Minister Gen Nakatan.
